conditions.short_description: Snow is widely considered stable. Isolated wind slabs could be present in the Eastfjords in southerly aspects. Warm weather on Thursday could trigger small avalanches, but after that snow is expected to settle and strengthen.
conditions.full_description: Snow is widely considered stable. Isolated wind slabs could be present in the Eastfjords in southerly aspects. Warm weather on Thursday could trigger small avalanches, but after that snow is expected to settle and strengthen.

area_forecast.forecast: Not much snow in the area but the remaining snow is considered stable.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Not much snow in the area. The remaining snow is considered mostly stable after freeze/thaw cycles. Warm weather and rain is forecast on Thursday and then snow should subside and settle further.
area_forecast.weather: Sunnanlægð með hlýindum og rigningu hátt upp í fjöll kemur yfir á fimmtudag. Eftir það hægari vindur, lítilsháttar úrkoma og kólnar smám saman.

area_forecast.forecast: There is snow in the mountains but considered mostly stable. Small slabs can be present in gullies and high elevations, but trigger is unlikely.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Snow has accumulated in gullies and wind slabs can be present high in starting zones and just below ridges. The snow is though generally stiff and considered stable. Temporary warm weather with rain on Thursday could trigger small avalanches, after that the snow is expected to settle. Little snow is at lower elevations.
area_forecast.weather: Sunnanlægð með hlýindum og rigningu hátt upp í fjöll kemur yfir á fimmtudag. Eftir það hægari vindur, lítilsháttar úrkoma og kólnar smám saman.

area_forecast.forecast: In the mountains, there is a thin layer of recent snow on top of older, firm snow that is generally considered stable. The snow might get wet in warm weather on Thursday night, though it might snow at the highest elevations.
area_forecast.snow_condition: In the mountains, there is a thin layer of recent snow on top of older, firm snow. Lower elevations are covered by a thin layer of snow. Rising temperatures are expected on Thursday accompanied by some precipitation, mostly in the form of rain. Snow cover in the mountains is likely to become wet, although snowfall may occur at the highest elevations. The snowpack is generally considered stable. Temperatures will start to turn colder again on Saturday which will further stabilize the snow.
area_forecast.weather: Rólegt veður þar til á fimmtudag er tekur að hlýna með nokkurri vætu.

area_forecast.forecast: Small, unstable wind slabs may be present, especially high in the mountains, in gullies and below ridgelines, mainly on south-facing aspects. The snow is though mostly considered stable.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: A small avalanche fell in Skeiðfell north of the road Norðfjarðarvegur. South facing gully, probably released on Saturday 15.11.
area_forecast.snow_condition: A little new snow has accumulated over the past week, with snow drift from northerly winds. Small wind slabs have formed in gullies and depressions facing south, and may be unstable in steep terrain. Most snow is though considered stable, with the older snowpack firm and the recent snow generally well bonded to it. Temporary warm weather on Thursday night might trigger small avalanches but after that, snow is expected to settle and gain strength.
area_forecast.weather: Tímabundin hlýindi aðfaranótt föstudags. Að öðru leyti kalt, frekur stillt og úrkomulítið.

weather_forecast.forecast: Low pressure system with S-wind and rain, especially in the South and East, arrives on Thursday. After that rather light wind is forecast, little precipitation and slowly cooling weather.
